title: Best Green Bean Casserole Recipe
description: This green bean casserole pairs tender green beans with crunchy French-fried onions in creamy cheese sauce. A family-favorite recipe for the holidays!

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Side Dish Casseroles Green Bean Casserole Recipes Best Green Bean Casserole 4.7 (1,127) 776 Reviews 225 Photos A green bean casserole makes the Thanksgiving holiday complete, and this version can be on the table in no time at all thanks to just four ingredients from your pantry or fridge: canned green beans, condensed mushroom soup, French-fried onions, and shredded Cheddar cheese. Submitted by Jan Updated on August 14, 2024 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 225 225 225 225 Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 15 mins Total Time: 25 mins Servings: 6 Jump to Nutrition Facts Jump to recipe This green bean casserole is truly the best. Made with just four budget-friendly ingredients, you'll come back to this green bean casserole recipe year after year. Green Bean Casserole Ingredients Believe it or not, you'll need just four ingredients to make this classic green bean casserole: Green beans: This easy green bean casserole starts with two drained cans of green beans.Canned soup: A can of condensed cream of mushroom soup creates a creamy texture and adds savory flavor.Cheese: This recipe calls for shredded Cheddar cheese. Use sharp, mild, or a blend of both.French-fried onions: The green bean casserole gets its crunch from a French-fried onion topping.Optional ingredients: Crumbled bacon, sautéed mushrooms or onions, garlic, Parmesan cheese, black pepper Dotdash Meredith Food Studios How to Make Green Bean Casserole You'll find the full, step-by-step recipe below — but here's a brief overview of what you can expect when you make this top-rated green bean casserole: Mix the beans and soup in a microwave-safe bowl and microwave until warm.Stir in half the cheese. Microwave until melted and well-blended.Transfer to a prepared baking dish. Top with fried onions and remaining cheese.Bake in the preheated oven until the cheese is melted and the onions are brown. How Long to Cook Green Bean Casserole In an oven preheated to 350 degrees F, this canned green bean casserole should be perfectly cooked in about 10 minutes. Of course, that doesn't include the 5-8 minutes the ingredients spend in the microwave! Can You Make Green Bean Casserole Ahead of Time? Yes! You can bake this green bean casserole up to three days in advance. Cook it according to the recipe, but leave off the French-fried onions. Allow it cool, cover tightly with foil, and refrigerate until you're ready to eat. How to Store Green Bean Casserole Allow the casserole to cool to room temperature, then cover tightly with storage wrap or transfer to an airtight container. Store in the refrigerator for up to four days. Reheat in the oven or in the microwave. Allrecipes Community Tips and Praise "Made it for Thanksgiving today, used French-style beans, 'cause that's how I remember it as a kid, and it was a perfect blast from the past," according to BBQ Dad. "My 9 year old loved it so it will definitely get made again." "This recipe has that classic flavor you think of when you think of a green bean casserole, and the added cheese is a really nice touch," raves Hiram Wigant. "Super easy to make and was delicious," says jdantana. "I ended up using frozen green beans that I thawed before making the casserole." Editorial contributions by Corey Williams Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 6 servings 2 (14.5 ounce) cans green beans, drained 1 (10.5 ounce) can condensed cream of mushroom soup 1 cup shredded Cheddar cheese, divided 1 (6 ounce) can French-fried onions Directions Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Mix green beans and condensed soup together in a large microwave-safe bowl until well combined. Microwave on high until warm, 3 to 5 minutes. Stir 1/2 cup Cheddar cheese into the green bean mixture. Microwave on high for 2 to 3 minutes. Transfer mixture to a casserole dish and spread evenly over the bottom. Sprinkle remaining Cheddar over top, then sprinkle with the French-fried onions. Bake in the preheated oven until cheese is melted and the onions are just turning brown, about 10 minutes. Recipe Tip To reheat: Remove the casserole from the fridge and let it come to room temperature for about 30 minutes. Top with French-fried onions and reheat in an oven preheated to 350 degrees F until the onions are golden brown and the casserole is heated through. I Made It Print 4,225 home cooks made it! Add Your Photo Photos of Best Green Bean Casserole 01 of 225 Photo by  Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 225 Photo by  Phil Cole 01/21/2025 Made it just like the Rx.. wonder if may be better not to nuke the cheese? 03 of 225 Photo by  SadBagel1548 12/01/2024 OK with tweaks Another family favorite, I only added cheddar cheese to the top under the layer of fried onions. Will be doing again next year as well. 👍🏻 04 of 225 Photo by  Alfonso Ponce 11/13/2024 Great flavors Easy to follow Worth the effort Easy to look for supermarket ingredients. I used extra sharp cheddar cheese which made the crust crispy, straw mushrooms were ok and overall I would like to make it again. 05 of 225 Photo by  ArtsyOats5707 01/01/2024 I added bacon bits 06 of 225 Photo by  BlueKale2191 11/23/2023 It was delicious, despite not being a good chef, I was still able to make it. 07 of 225 Photo by  pixiebaker 06/12/2023 I made this green bean casserole today and it came out perfectly. The only change I made was adding the second layer of cheese underneath the French fried onions because I wanted the onions to be crispy. I will never use another recipe again, as there is no need to! This was so quick and easy to make and so delicious that it's going in my "keeper" file. 08 of 225 Photo by  Lela 12/10/2022 We really liked this green bean casserole. So easy to make. We added bacon and mushrooms which gave the casserole a good flavor. I added cooked bacon and mushrooms before baking. 09 of 225 Photo by  Wanda Mitchell 11/25/2022 I simply love it and so does my family we will make this Thanksgiving Christmas any holidays that we want to use it for our green bean casserole forever now it is the best hats off to the chef 10 of 225 Photo by  vicki27church 11/26/2021 I absolutely loved it and was easy to make. Instead of microwaving because I didn't have a big enough bowl, I cooked green beans, soup, and added 1/4 cup of milk on stove top over medium heat for 5 minutes. Added 1/2 cup of shredded cheddar cheese and cooked another 3-5 minutes until cheese was melted. Then continued to make as directions indicated! It was delicious! 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love Mom's Green Bean Vegetable Casserole 26 Ratings Green Bean Casserole with Frozen Green Beans 9 Ratings Green Bean and Potato Casserole 100 Ratings Bacon & Cheddar Green Bean Casserole 22 Ratings Pearl's Green Bean Casserole 57 Ratings French Onion Green Bean Casserole 203 Ratings Dairy-Free Green Bean Casserole 2 Ratings Never Enough Green Bean Casserole 439 Ratings Slow Cooker Green Bean Casserole 179 Ratings Grandma's Green Bean Casserole 3,070 Ratings Garlic Green Beans 1,265 Ratings Absolutely Delicious Green Bean Casserole from Scratch 154 Ratings Ruth Cullen's Green Bean Bake 8 Ratings Crunchy Green Bean Casserole 102 Ratings Vintage Fresh Green Bean Casserole (circa 1956) 33 Ratings Sweet and Sour Green Beans 86 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family.
